org.spongepowered.api.entity

Interface Entity

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DataHolder, EntityState, Identifiable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Ageable, Agent, Animal, ArmorStand, Arrow, Bat, Blaze, Boat, CaveSpider, Chicken, ComplexLiving, ComplexLivingPart, Cow, Creeper, Egg, EnderCrystal, EnderDragon, EnderDragonPart, Enderman, Endermite, EnderPearl, ExperienceOrb, Explosive, EyeOfEnder, FallingBlock, Fireball, Firework, FishHook, FusedExplosive, Ghast, Giant, Golem, Guardian, Hanging, Horse, Human, IronGolem, Item, ItemFrame, LargeFireball, LeashHitch, Lightning, Living, MagmaCube, Minecart, MinecartChest, MinecartCommandBlock, MinecartContainer, MinecartFurnace, MinecartHopper, MinecartMobSpawner, MinecartRideable, MinecartTNT, Monster, Mooshroom, Ocelot, Painting, Pig, Player, PrimedTNT, Projectile, Rabbit, Sheep, Silverfish, Sittable, Skeleton, Slime, SmallFireball, Snowball, SnowGolem, Spider, Squid, Tameable, ThrownExpBottle, ThrownPotion, Villager, WeatherEffect, Witch, Wither, WitherSkull, Wolf, Zombie, ZombiePigman

    public interface Entity
extends Identifiable, EntityState, DataHolder
    An entity is a Minecraft entity.

    Examples of entities include:

    • Zombies
    • Sheep
    • Players
    • Dropped items
    • Dropped experience points
    • etc.

    Blocks and items (when they are in inventories) are not entities.

              double y,
              double z,
              @Nullable
              World world)
        Teleports this entity to the target position specified by x, y, z, and world.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate
        y - The y coordinate
        z - The z coordinate
        world - The world to teleport to, if available

      • getVectorRotation

        Vector3f getVectorRotation()
        Gets the rotation as a vector. This does not support the roll component of the entity's rotation.
        Returns:
        A possibly, but not necessarily, unit vector

      • setVectorRotation

        void setVectorRotation(Vector3f rotation)
        Sets the rotation to a vector. This does not support the roll component of the entity's rotation, any previous roll value will be removed.
        Parameters:
        rotation - The rotation to set the entity to

      • getRotation
